prompt: Council's put smart cams all round Bute Street and the Docks, fam. They say it's for 'traffic management' by the Noor, but we all know it's facial rec scanning the uncles going to prayer. Do we smash the sensors or try to jam the signal with IR lights?

These new property developers in the Bay are using AI to map 'antisocial hotspots' to lower insurance premiums for the new flats. But they're flagging our community centre as a 'high risk zone' just cause the boys hang out outside. How do we fight an algo that thinks our culture is a crime risk?

Feds are using some predictive software in Grangetown now, see. It's targeting Somali lads for stop and search based on 'historical data' from when the area was rougher. It's a self-fulfilling prophecy, innit? The more they search, the more data they get.

Museum wants to digitise the oral histories of the Tiger Bay elders, which is lush, but they want to own the copyright and train their 'Cardiff accent' AI on it. That voice belongs to the community, not some tech startup in London.

Youth club in Butetown got funding, but the condition is installing biometric entry systems. Most of the Yemeni parents aren't having it—don't want their kids' fingerprints on a database shared with the Home Office. Do we take the money and the surveillance, or stay broke?

Housing association in the Bay is fitting 'smart meters' that track occupancy. They reckon it's for energy efficiency, but it feels like they're checking how many relatives we got staying over. It's spying on our hospitality, straight up.

Applied for a job in the city centre, mind. The AI video interview rejected me. My cousin reckons it's cause the software can't handle the Cardiff Somali accent—thinks we're aggressive when we're just talking normal. Is it worth appealing or is the system rigged?

There's a 'Safe Streets' app everyone in the Bay is using to report issues. Problem is, the new posh residents are flagging 'loitering' every time three black boys stand on a corner. The app auto-forwards to police. It's digital gentrification, turning neighbours into narcs.

Local Facebook group for the valley is absolutely buzzing with bots chopsing about 'gangs' every time a brown face walks past the welfare hall. Admin won't delete it, says it's 'free speech'. It's making my nan scared to leave the house. Do we hack the group or what?

Living up the top of the Rhondda, signal is shocking. Now the GP wants us to do video consults only. My mum's English isn't great, and the connection cuts out every ten seconds. She's not getting treated cause the tech doesn't work in the valleys. Is that not negligence?

Walking home from the train station in the dark, using this safety app. It keeps diverting me away from 'high crime' areas, which happens to be the only street where other Asians live. It's routing me through the pitch black woods instead. The algo is racist and it's gonna get me hurt.

School in Merthyr is using AI to monitor 'radicalisation risks' on the kids' tablets. My boy searched for 'Palestine history' and got flagged to the headmaster. Now he's on a list. He's twelve, mun. How do we stop this Prevent nonsense creeping into the software?

Got a remote job interview, but the background noise cancellation kept cutting my voice out cause of the echo in our terraced house, and the AI didn't like my valleys accent either. Told me I wasn't 'professional'. It's bias against the working class, plain and simple.

All the shops in town are going cashless, card only. My uncle, he's old school, deals in cash, doesn't trust the banks or the apps. He's being locked out of buying milk and bread in his own village. Is digital exclusion a human rights thing?

Fibre is going in down Cardiff, but up here in the valleys they say it's 'not commercially viable'. We're stuck on copper wire. Can't apply for jobs, can't study. It's digital apartheid keeping the valleys poor.

Universal Credit algo flagged me for fraud cause I logged in from an internet café in Ponty instead of my home IP. Sanctioned me for a month. No human to talk to, just a 'computer says no'. How do you feed the kids on an error code?

Home Office gave us these Aspen cards for food, but they track every penny and location. Now they want GPS tagging on our phones as a condition of bail in Swansea. It's an open prison, just digital. Do we refuse and risk detention?

Dispersed to Wrexham, see. All the council forms online are in English or Welsh. I speak Kurdish. The Google Translate plugin makes a mess of the Welsh government jargon. I missed a housing deadline cause the translation said 'bin day' instead of 'court date'.

They took my passport, now my only ID is this digital QR code on a phone that barely charges. If the battery dies, I don't exist. Police stop me in town, I can't prove who I am. We need a physical card, not this digital tether.

Charity in Swansea offered us free SIM cards, which is tidy. But the terms say they share usage data with 'partners'. If one of those partners is the Home Office, we're done for. Is it safe to take the charity?

South Wales Police are trialling facial rec in the city centre again. For us refugees, avoiding the cameras is survival. We're mapping the blind spots on WhatsApp groups. Is avoiding surveillance a crime if you're seeking asylum?

My PTSD therapy is all via an app now. The AI chatbot doesn't understand cultural trauma, just gives generic advice in English. It's triggering, not helping. I need a human who understands why I ran, not a bot.

The dispersal algorithm sent my cousin to a village where there's no other Muslims and the bus runs once a day. The computer optimised for 'cheap housing' but ignored 'safety' and 'community'. It's isolating us by design.

Kids' school in Swansea gave them iPads, but blocked WhatsApp and YouTube. That's how we talk to family back home. They've cut the lifeline. Do we jailbreak the school tablets just to say goodnight to their grandmother?

Council put a 360 camera right by the entrance to the site in Rover Way. Reckon it's for 'fly-tipping' but it logs every trailer coming and going. We can't even visit family without being on a database. It's harassment, pure and simple.

Farmers are using thermal drones to watch their fields, but they keep hovering over our stopping place. Spying on the chavvies playing outside. Police say it's private property so they can't stop it. Since when is privacy only for the gorgers (non-Romani)?

Education board wants the little ones to use this learning app while we're travelling. But it tracks GPS location to 'verify attendance'. If we move to a non-authorised spot, the app flags us to the council enforcement team. It's a trap.

Every time we move counties, the digital health records don't link up. My nan's heart meds get messed up cause the Welsh NHS computer in Cardiff doesn't talk to the one in Newport properly. We need a portable digital record that *we* control.

Can't get a phone contract cause the credit check AI automatically rejects 'care of' addresses or caravan sites. It marks us as 'high risk' just for being Travellers. We're forced to use Pay As You Go which costs twice as much. It's the poverty premium.

Local paper put a story online about a new site proposal. The comments section is vile, proper hate speech. The moderation AI doesn't catch the specific slurs they use against Romanis in Wales. We reported it, but the platform says it doesn't violate standards.

New voter ID laws require photo ID. Applying online requires a permanent address history. We've been moving for three generations. The digital system is designed to disenfranchise us. How do we vote when the drop-down menu doesn't have an option for 'Roadside'?
Police ANPR cameras are targeting our vans specifically. You drive a transit with a tow bar, you get flagged. We can't drive to the shop without getting pulled over. It's automated profiling.

Trying to use this government helpline AI. It asks if I want English or Welsh. I speak English with a heavy Somali accent, and it can't understand me. I don't speak Welsh. So I'm stuck in limbo, hanging up. The tech assumes you're fluent in one of the two 'official' voices.

My kid's school sends all the letters via an app that auto-translates to Welsh first, then you have to click through to get English, but there's no button for Arabic. They're prioritising the Welsh language standards over the parents actually understanding the message.

There's big money for AI to learn Welsh, fair play. But what about the specific dialect of the Cardiff Docks? That mix of Arabic, Somali, and Welsh English is dying out. The tech is standardising everything to 'BBC Welsh' or 'BBC English'. We're losing our flavour.

Applying for funding for our BAME community group. The online portal crashes if you don't fill in the Welsh language impact assessment. We want to support Welsh, but we're struggling just to keep the lights on. It's a digital barrier to entry for immigrant groups.

The hospital is using a new transcription AI. It's great for Welsh speakers, finally. But when my auntie mixes Hindi with English, it writes down gibberish in the medical notes. It's dangerous. The model needs to be multilingual, not just bilingual.

We're using Welsh words in our group chat to avoid the censorship bots, cause the American AI doesn't know Welsh slang. Now the platform is banning us for 'suspicious encrypted behaviour'. We're just speaking our language, mun.

Bought my nan an Alexa to help her with reminders. It doesn't understand 'cwtch' or 'now in a minute'. It forces her to speak like a posh English person just to turn the lights on. It's colonising her living room.

Court transcript software is mandated to produce Welsh and English records. But the defendant spoke broken English and the interpreter was translating to Urdu. The official digital record wiped out the nuance of the translation errors. The tech erased the injustice.
